name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. William Ray BLEVINS, Appellee

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. William Ray BLEVINS, Appellee.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
Judgment of sentence affirmed. Appellant, William Ray Blevins, failed to raise the alleged assignments of error in his motions for new trial and arrest of judgment and, hence, is precluded from raising these questions on appeal. See, e. g., Commonwealth v. Reid, 458 Pa. 357 326 A.2d 267 (1974); Commonwealth v. Clair, Pa., 326 A.2d 272 (1974); Commonwealth v. Goodman, 454 Pa. 358, 311 A.2d 652 (1973); and Commonwealth v. Myers, 439 Pa. 381, 384-385, 266 A.2d 756, 758 (1970).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: MacElree, Platt, Harvey & Gallagher, Michael B. Kean, West Chester, for appellant.
Michael Joseph Melody, First Dist. Atty., West Chester, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
331 A.2d 180
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. William Ray BLEVINS, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Sept. 30, 1974.
Decided Jan. 27, 1975.
MacElree, Platt, Harvey & Gallagher, Michael B. Kean, West Chester, for appellant.
Michael Joseph Melody, First Dist. Atty., West Chester, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
